meanings.definition: A well or shaft for draining surface water.
meanings.sent1: The drywells in our neighborhood help prevent flooding during heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew dug drywells to manage the excess water from the road.
meanings.sent3: Why did the water droplet refuse to go near the drywells? It was afraid of getting trapped!
meanings.sent4: The drywells acted like giant straws, sucking up all the rainwater from the street.
meanings.sent5: The drywells resembled thirsty giants, eagerly drinking up every drop of rain that fell.

meanings.definition: A method of disposing of stormwater runoff by allowing it to percolate into the ground.
meanings.sent1: After the heavy storm, the drywells quickly absorbed all the excess water.
meanings.sent2: City planners decided to install drywells to prevent water pollution in the river.
meanings.sent3: Why did the drywells throw a party? Because they loved soaking up all the rainwater!
meanings.sent4: The drywells functioned like nature's sponges, soaking up the rainwater effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The drywells were like secret underground reservoirs, silently storing away the stormwater.
